A user is unable to assume the IAM role in the target account. The policy attached to the role in the identity account is:
//IMG//

What should be done to enable the user to assume the appropriate role in the target account?

discussion.content:

questions.question_text:
A company has enabled Amazon GuardDuty in all AWS Regions as part of its security monitoring strategy. In one of its VPCs, the company hosts an Amazon EC2 instance that works as an FTP server. A high number of clients from multiple locations contact the FTP server. GuardDuty identifies this activity as a brute force attack because of the high number of connections that happen every hour.
The company has flagged the finding as a false positive, but GuardDuty continues to raise the issue. A security engineer must improve the signal-to-noise ratio without compromising the company's visibility of potential anomalous behavior.
Which solution will meet these requirements?

choices.A: Disable the FTP rule in GuardDuty in the Region where the FTP server is deployed.
choices.B: Add the FTP server to a trusted IP list. Deploy the list to GuardDuty to stop receiving the notifications.
choices.C: Create a suppression rule in GuardDuty to filter findings by automatically archiving new findings that match the specified criteria.
choices.D: Create an AWS Lambda function that has the appropriate permissions to delete the finding whenever a new occurrence is reported.

choices.B: Recreate the ECR repositories with KMS encryption and ECR scanning enabled. Analyze the scan report after the next push of images.
choices.A: Enable KMS encryption on the existing ECR repositories. Install Amazon Inspector Agent from the ECS container instances’ user data. Run an assessment with the CVE rules.
choices.C: Recreate the ECR repositories with KMS encryption and ECR scanning enabled. Install AWS Systems Manager Agent on the ECS container instances. Run an inventory report.
choices.D: Enable KMS encryption on the existing ECR repositories. Use AWS Trusted Advisor to check the ECS container instances and to verify the findings against a list of current CVEs.
